intro: Purdiaea nipensis subsp. maestrensis, commonly known as the Maestrense Purdiaea, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered in its natural range.
